sen.j: 与党となった憲政党のうち、旧進歩党 (日本)系の大隈を首相に、旧自由党 (日本)系の板垣退助を特に内務大臣 (日本)に迎えて組織した。
sen.e: Among the Constitutional Party in power, the cabinet was organized with Okuma from the former Progressive Party (Japan) as the Prime Minister and Taisuke ITAGAKI from the former Liberal Party (Japan) as Minister of Home Affairs.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Among the Constitutional Party in power, the cabinet was organized with OKUMA from the former Progressive Party (Japan) as the Prime Minister and Taisuke ITAGAKI from the former Liberal Party (Japan) as Minister of Home Affairs.

Among the Constitutional Party in power, the cabinet was organized with OKUMA from the former Progressive Party (Japan) as the Prime Minister and Taisuke ITAGAKI from the former Liberal Party (Japan) as Minister of Home Affairs.

sen.j: そのため、大隈の「隈」と板垣の「板」をとって隈板内閣（わいはんないかく）ともいう。
sen.e: Therefore, the cabinet is also called the Waihan Cabinet derived from Okuma and Itagaki's names.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, the cabinet is also called the Waihan Cabinet derived from Okuma and Itagaki's names.
Therefore, the cabinet is also called the Waihan Cabinet derived from Okuma and Itagaki's names.

sen.j: 第3次伊藤内閣が伊藤博文の政党組織準備のために総辞職した。
sen.e: The third Ito Cabinet resigned en masse to prepare for party organization for Hirobumi ITO.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The third Ito Cabinet resigned en masse to prepare for party organization for Hirobumi ITO.
The third Ito Cabinet resigned en masse to prepare for party organization for Hirobumi ITO.

sen.j: 元老が議会勢力に妥協した結果、当時衆議院第一党であった憲政党の首班大隈と板垣に大命が降下されて組閣された。
sen.e: As a result of compromise of Genro (elder statesman) to force of the Diet, Okuma, who was the head seat of the Constitutional Party, the leading party in the House of Representatives at that time, and Itagaki formed the cabinet, receiving an Imperial mandate.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: As a result of compromise of Genro (elder statesman) to force of the Diet, OKUMA, who was the head seat of the Constitutional Party, the leading party in the House of Representatives at that time, and ITAGAKI formed the cabinet, receiving an Imperial mandate.
sen.cmt: OKUMAとITAGAKIを大文字に変更しました。
sen.e: As a result of compromise of Genro (elder statesman) to force of the Diet, OKUMA, who was the head seat of the Constitutional Party, the leading party in the House of Representatives at that time, and ITAGAKI formed the cabinet, receiving an Imperial mandate.

sen.j: 首班が議会（衆議院）に議席を持たないという意味ではやや条件を欠くが、軍部大臣以外を政党人によってかためたという点では、日本史上初の政党内閣であるといえる。
sen.e: Although the cabinet lacked the condition in the sense that the head seat did not have position in the diet (the House of Representatives), it was Japan's first party cabinet in terms of the fact that the cabinet members were not from the military but from political parties.

Although the cabinet lacked the condition in the sense that the head seat did not have position in the diet (the House of Representatives), it was Japan's first party cabinet in terms of the fact that the cabinet members were not from the military but from political parties.

Although the cabinet lacked the condition in the sense that the head seat did not have position in the diet (the House of Representatives), it was Japan's first party cabinet in terms of the fact that the cabinet members were not from the military but from political parties.

sen.j: しかし寄合所帯の憲政党内部では、旧進歩党 (日本)系と旧自由党 (日本)系の軋轢が強かった。
sen.e: However, inside the Constitutional Party, which was congeries of parties, conflict between the former Progressive Party (Japan) side and the former Liberal Party (Japan) side was serious.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, inside the Constitutional Party, which was congeries of parties, conflict between the former Progressive Party (Japan) side and the former Liberal Party (Japan) side was serious.
However, inside the Constitutional Party, which was congeries of parties, conflict between the former Progressive Party (Japan) side and the former Liberal Party (Japan) side was serious.

sen.j: 自由党系が求めていた星亨の外相任命を大隈が拒んで自ら兼務を続けた。
sen.e: The Liberal Party side requested Toru HOSHI to be appointed as the Foreign Minister, but Okuma refused it and doubled as Foreign Minister.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Liberal Party side requested Toru HOSHI to be appointed as the Foreign Minister, but OKUMA refused it and doubled as Foreign Minister.
sen.cmt: OKUMAを大文字に変更しました。
sen.e: The Liberal Party side requested Toru HOSHI to be appointed as the Foreign Minister, but OKUMA refused it and doubled as Foreign Minister.

sen.j: それに加え、文相尾崎行雄の共和演説事件による罷免をめぐり後任人事が両者間で紛糾し、星らによる憲政党の分裂騒ぎに発展。
sen.e: In addition, dismissal of Yukio OZAKI, the Minister of Education, triggered by the Kyowa enzetsu affair brought an entanglement of replacement that escalated into division of the Constitutional Party by HOSHI
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In addition, dismissal of Yukio OZAKI, the Minister of Education, triggered by the Kyowa enzetsu affair brought an entanglement of replacement that escalated into division of the Constitutional Party by HOSHI

In addition, dismissal of Yukio OZAKI, the Minister of Education, triggered by the Kyowa enzetsu affair brought an entanglement of replacement that escalated into division of the Constitutional Party by HOSHI

sen.j: 組閣後4ヶ月余りで総辞職を余儀なくされた。
sen.e: The cabinet was forced to resign en masse four month after the cabinetmaking.
The cabinet was forced to resign en masse four month after the cabinetmaking.
The cabinet was forced to resign en masse four month after the cabinetmaking.

sen.j: 在任 1898年（明治31年）6月30日 - 同年11月8日

Shigenobu OKUMA, a count (Saga clique; the Constitutional Party, the former Progressive Party faction)
